title: ion-split-pane
body:
A split pane is useful when creating multi-view layouts. It allows UI elements, like menus, to be
displayed as the viewport width increases.

If the device's screen width is below a certain size, the split pane will collapse and the menu will be hidden. This is ideal for creating an app that will be served in a browser and deployed through the app store to phones and tablets.
By default, the split pane will expand when the screen is larger than 992px. To customize this, pass a breakpoint in the
property can accept a boolean value, any valid media query, or one of Ionic's predefined sizes.
<!-- can be any valid media query https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/Media_Queries/Using_media_queries -->
Show the split-pane when the min-width is 0px (meaning, always)
Show the split-pane when the min-width is 576px
Show the split-pane when the min-width is 768px
Show the split-pane when the min-width is 992px (default break point)
Show the split-pane when the min-width is 1200px

props.name: contentId
props.docs: The content id of the split-pane's main content.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If true, the split pane will be hidden.

props.name: when
props.docs: When the split-pane should be shown. Can be a CSS media query expression, or a shortcut expression. Can also be a boolean expression.

docs:
A split pane is useful when creating multi-view layouts. It allows UI elements, like menus, to be
displayed as the viewport width increases.

If the device's screen width is below a certain size, the split pane will collapse and the menu will be hidden. This is ideal for creating an app that will be served in a browser and deployed through the app store to phones and tablets.

events.docs: Expression to be called when the split-pane visibility has changed

styles.name: --side-max-width
styles.docs: Maximum width of the side pane. Does not apply when split pane is collapsed.

styles.name: --side-min-width
styles.docs: Minimum width of the side pane. Does not apply when split pane is collapsed.

styles.name: --side-width
styles.docs: Width of the side pane. Does not apply when split pane is collapsed.
